newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil futures end sharply up, boosted by hea.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil futures end sharply up, boosted by hea.

text.p: IPE gas oil futures ended sharply higher on Thursday, boosted by strong NYMEX heating oil, brokers said.
February gas oil futures last traded $7.75 a tonne higher at the intra-day high of $212.25 a tonne boosted by strong heating oil on NYMEX.
Bullish U.S. distillate inventory data on Wednesday and forecasts for colder weather in the U.S. Northeast were the main driving factors, traders said.
"I think it's just a continuation of yesterday helped by the cold weather in the States," one broker said.
Independent forecaster Weather Services Corp saw below average temperatures in the key heating market of the U.S. Northeast over the next few days, increasing heating needs.
Temperatures in Northwest Europe were also forecast to be slightly below normal for the rest of the week.
In a consolidation of Wednesday's gains March Brent traded 11 cents higher at $22.88 a barrel at 1745 GMT. The contract tested $23 in early afternoon trade.
Dealers said there was a more bullish tone to the market, but said it would need more news before it could push through resistance at $23.00.
